description:
YouTube’s Product Partnerships team accelerates the global growth and innovation of YouTube products by driving new business opportunities through partnerships. We own the business side of new features, products and initiatives that are vital to the success of YouTube. As a team member, you understand the landscape of partnerships opportunities across technology licensing/integrations, marketing, and distribution. You will also craft strategies, define and structure critical partnerships, negotiate agreements, and cultivate our relationships.

In this role, you'll assess partnerships opportunities, define a strategy, and work closely with Product teams and stakeholders to drive partnerships that'll help evolve our business. You're a thought leader, who has experience with cross-functional leadership and can clue us into industry trends and key influencers.

The Trust and Safety team works to help YouTube grow responsibly. On the Trust and Safety Product Partnerships team, you'll execute and maintain strategic partnerships that safeguard the YouTube experience by enhancing our existing tools, technology and intelligence. You’ll work closely with Product and Engineering teams to identify platform and content abuse vectors and where outside expertise can plug in. You’re as comfortable discussing with Engineering how a partner inputs into our technical workflows as you are diving into its implications with Legal and Policy. You're thoughtful, strategic, analytically-driven, and possess a global perspective. You thrive in a fast-paced, ever-evolving, team-oriented environment.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of relevant partnership development experience, including identifying partners, structuring agreements, partner management, and sensitive partnerships.
  • 4 years of experience working with Product, Engineering and Legal teams in a technology environment.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working in Trust and Safety policy areas.
  • Experience operating within and leading cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Legal, Policy, Operations, etc.) across initiatives.
  • Program management or consulting experience.
  • Passion for and understanding of YouTube products with the ability to quickly learn new technologies.
  • Demonstrated problem-solving and collaboration skills, including an entrepreneurial and creative approach, persistence and attention to detail.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to formulate and articulate technical, financial and business points with partners and internal teams. Comfort escalating issues when appropriate.
responsibilities:
• Be a domain expert and thought leader within an assigned area.
  • Develop and maintain strategic partnerships with external Trust and Safety teams, including sourcing partners, structuring and working on agreements, and partner management.
  • Develop and maintain partnerships with external content partners, and work on agreements.
  • Lead cross-functional teams to secure buy-in for partnerships, solve legal, policy, business, operational and technical problems, and secure budget.
title: Product Partnerships Manager, Trust and Safety, YouTube
